body_html:
The docs part of this problem is fixed, at some point between r1.1 and r1.2. Compare:

https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.1/api_docs/python/tf/nn/max_pool3d
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.2/api_docs/python/tf/nn/max_pool3d

I don't know the details of how that list is generated, but given that this is a generated python wrapper that the docs are generated from, I doubt it is something trivial enough that we would be able to cherry-pick back onto the old releases.

It's not a total solution to your problem, but this op did gain bfloat16 suport in r1.5:

https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.5/api_docs/python/tf/nn/max_pool3d

body:
The docs part of this problem is fixed, at some point between r1.1 and r1.2. Compare:

https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.1/api_docs/python/tf/nn/max_pool3d
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.2/api_docs/python/tf/nn/max_pool3d

I don't know the details of how that list is generated, but given that this is a generated python wrapper that the docs are generated from, I doubt it is something trivial enough that we would be able to cherry-pick back onto the old releases. 

It's not a total solution to your problem, but this op did gain `bfloat16` suport in `r1.5`:

https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.5/api_docs/python/tf/nn/max_pool3d
